title: 113_hr1728
content: The "Enforce Existing Gun Laws Act" is the short title of the Act. It repeals certain appropriations riders that limit the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives' ability to administer federal firearms laws. The Act repeals restrictions on the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives' enforcement of federal firearms laws, including the prohibition on consolidating firearms acquisition records and the requirement for physical inventory checks by dealers. The Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2012 is amended to require the destruction of instant check records within 24 hours. Additionally, limitations on firearms trace data, specifically the Tiahrt amendments, are modified by removing the 6th proviso. The 6th proviso under the heading "Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives--Salaries and Expenses" in two different Acts is amended to specify the fiscal year of implementation. The 6th proviso under the heading "Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives--Salaries and Expenses" in two Acts is amended to specify the fiscal year of implementation. The 6th proviso under the heading in two Acts is amended to specify the fiscal year of implementation. Prohibition on processing freedom of information act requests about arson, explosives incidents, or firearm traces is repealed. Prohibition on using firearms trace data to draw broad conclusions about firearms-related crime is also repealed. The provisions related to firearms regulations in the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Acts of 2012 and 2013 are repealed, including prohibitions on certain firearm imports and federal firearms license denials. The 6th proviso in the "Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives--Salaries and Expenses" section of the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013 is removed.
